data.text: Ephraim feedeth on wind, and followeth after the east wind:
The Lord hath also a controversy with Judah,
He took his brother by the heel in the womb,
Yea, he had power over the angel, and prevailed:
Even the Lord God of hosts; the Lord is his memorial.
Therefore turn thou to thy God:
He is a merchant, the balances of deceit are in his hand:
And Ephraim said, Yet I am become rich, I have found me out substance:
And I that am the Lord thy God from the land of Egypt
I have also spoken by the prophets, and I have multiplied visions,
Is there iniquity in Gilead? surely they are vanity:
And Jacob fled into the country of Syria,
And by a prophet the Lord brought Israel out of Egypt,
Ephraim provoked him to anger most bitterly:
